meanings.definition: To release from bonds or restraints.
meanings.sent1: She had to unbind the rope to set the dog free.
meanings.sent2: Please unbind the chains before entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to unbind himself from the handcuffs but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to unbind the sadness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The key to happiness is to unbind yourself from negative thoughts.

meanings.definition: To free from fastening or attachment.
meanings.sent1: He needed to unbind the stuck door to get inside.
meanings.sent2: The sailor had to unbind the knots in the rope to sail smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero quickly unbinded the hostages from the ropes with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the ability to unbind his worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth seemed to unbind the frozen ground, welcoming spring.

meanings.sent1: She gently unbinded the ribbon from the gift box.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to unbind the vines from the fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to unbind the yarn ball but only made a mess.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had the power to unbind the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to unbind the memories of his childhood, filling him with nostalgia.
